conclusion: Use principles of conservation of momentum and kinematics to determine exit velocity of bullet.
Initial momentum of the system (bullet + ball) is mv_0 and final momentum is (M + m)v.
By conservation of momentum, mv_0 = (M + m)v.
Use kinematic equations to relate horizontal distance s and height h.
Time t for ball to fall from height h is t = sqrt(2h/g).
Horizontal distance s is given by s = vt.
From kinematic equation, s = v sqrt(2h/g).
Solving for v gives v = s sqrt(g/2h).
Substitute v from kinematic relation to get v_0 = (M + m) s sqrt(g/2h)/m.
Final expression for exit velocity of bullet v_0 is (M + m) s/m sqrt(g/2h).
